1â†’# Tasks: DEFSTRUCT Wasm Compilation
     2â†’
     3â†’**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/001-defstruct-wasm-compile/`
     4â†’**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
     5â†’
     6â†’**Tests**: TDD is REQUIRED per Constitution Principle VII. Tests MUST be written first and FAIL before implementation.
     7â†’
     8â†’**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing.
     9â†’
    10â†’## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11â†’
    12â†’- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13â†’- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (US1, US2, US3, US4)
    14â†’- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15â†’
    16â†’## Path Conventions
    17â†’
    18â†’Per plan.md, single project structure:
    19â†’- Source: `src/clysm/lib/`, `src/clysm/clos/`
    20â†’- Tests: `tests/unit/`, `tests/contract/`, `tests/integration/`
    21â†’
    22â†’---
    23â†’
    24â†’## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure) âœ…
    25â†’
    26â†’**Purpose**: Create file stubs and project structure for defstruct implementation
    27â†’
    28â†’- [X] T001 Create defstruct macro file stub in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    29â†’- [X] T002 [P] Create structure-class metaclass file stub in src/clysm/clos/structure-class.lisp
    30â†’- [X] T003 [P] Create unit test file in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
    31â†’- [X] T004 [P] Create contract test file in tests/contract/defstruct-wasm-test.lisp
    32â†’- [X] T005 [P] Create integration test file in tests/integration/defstruct-usage-test.lisp
    33â†’- [X] T006 Update ASDF system definition to include new files in clysm.asd
    34â†’
    35â†’---
    36â†’
    37â†’## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites) âœ…
    38â†’
    39â†’**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented
    40â†’
    41â†’**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: All user stories depend on structure-class and parsing infrastructure
    42â†’
    43â†’### Tests for Foundational
    44â†’
    45â†’- [X] T007 [P] Unit test for defstruct-definition struct parsing in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
    46â†’- [X] T008 [P] Unit test for slot-definition struct parsing in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
    47â†’- [X] T009 Unit test for structure-class metaclass in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
    48â†’
    49â†’### Implementation for Foundational
    50â†’
    51â†’- [X] T010 Implement defstruct-definition struct (name, options, slots) in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    52â†’- [X] T011 [P] Implement slot-definition struct (name, initform, type, read-only) in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    53â†’- [X] T012 Implement parse-defstruct function to parse defstruct forms in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    54â†’- [X] T013 Implement parse-slot-description function in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    55â†’- [X] T014 Implement structure-class metaclass extending standard-class in src/clysm/clos/structure-class.lisp
    56â†’- [X] T015 Register structure-class in *class-registry* in src/clysm/clos/structure-class.lisp
    57â†’
    58â†’**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - parsing and metaclass infrastructure complete
    59â†’
    60â†’---
    61â†’
    62â†’## Phase 3: User Story 1 + 4 - Basic Structure Definition & Setf Accessors (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP
    63â†’
    64â†’**Goal**: Compile basic defstruct with slots, constructor, accessors, and setf support
    65â†’
    66â†’**Independent Test**: `(defstruct point x y)` compiles to valid Wasm; make-point, point-x, (setf point-x) all work
    67â†’
    68â†’### Tests for User Story 1+4 âš ï¸
    69â†’
    70â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    71â†’
    72â†’- [X] T016 [P] [US1] Unit test for basic defstruct expansion `(defstruct point x y)` in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
    73â†’- [X] T017 [P] [US1] Unit test for generated constructor make-point in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
    74â†’- [X] T018 [P] [US1] Unit test for generated accessor point-x, point-y in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
    75â†’- [X] T019 [P] [US4] Unit test for setf expander generation for point-x in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
    76â†’- [ ] T020 [US1] Contract test for defstruct Wasm output validation in tests/contract/defstruct-wasm-test.lisp
    77â†’- [ ] T021 [US1] Integration test for defstruct compile-and-run in tests/integration/defstruct-usage-test.lisp
    78â†’
    79â†’### Implementation for User Story 1+4
    80â†’
    81â†’- [X] T022 [US1] Implement generate-defclass-form to expand to defclass* in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    82â†’- [X] T023 [US1] Implement generate-constructor to create make-NAME function in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    83â†’- [X] T024 [US1] Implement generate-accessors to create NAME-slot functions in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    84â†’- [X] T025 [US1] Implement generate-predicate to create NAME-p function in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    85â†’- [X] T026 [US1] Implement generate-copier to create copy-NAME function in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    86â†’- [X] T027 [US4] Implement generate-setf-expanders using register-setf-expander in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    87â†’- [X] T028 [US1] Implement expand-defstruct to combine all generated forms into progn in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    88â†’- [X] T029 [US1] Create defstruct macro expander function in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    89â†’- [X] T030 [US1] Register defstruct macro in *global-macro-registry* in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
    90â†’- [X] T031 [US1] Add install-defstruct-macro to install-standard-macros in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp (self-installing at load time)
    91â†’
    92â†’**Checkpoint**: Basic defstruct with constructor, accessors, and setf fully functional
    93â†’
    94â†’---
    95â†’
    96â†’## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Structure Options Support (Priority: P2)
    97â†’
    98â†’**Goal**: Support :conc-name, :predicate, :copier, :constructor options
    99â†’
   100â†’**Independent Test**: `(defstruct (node (:conc-name n-)) left right)` generates n-left, n-right accessors
   101â†’
   102â†’### Tests for User Story 2 âš ï¸
   103â†’
   104â†’- [ ] T032 [P] [US2] Unit test for :conc-name option parsing in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   105â†’- [ ] T033 [P] [US2] Unit test for :conc-name nil (no prefix) in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   106â†’- [ ] T034 [P] [US2] Unit test for :predicate option with custom name in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   107â†’- [ ] T035 [P] [US2] Unit test for :predicate nil (suppress predicate) in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   108â†’- [ ] T036 [P] [US2] Unit test for :copier option with custom name in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   109â†’- [ ] T037 [P] [US2] Unit test for :copier nil (suppress copier) in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   110â†’- [ ] T038 [P] [US2] Unit test for :constructor option with custom name in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   111â†’- [ ] T039 [P] [US2] Unit test for :constructor nil (suppress constructor) in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   112â†’- [ ] T040 [US2] Unit test for slot default values (initform) in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   113â†’- [ ] T041 [US2] Unit test for :read-only slot option in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   114â†’
   115â†’### Implementation for User Story 2
   116â†’
   117â†’- [ ] T042 [US2] Implement parse-defstruct-options to extract :conc-name, :predicate, :copier, :constructor in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   118â†’- [ ] T043 [US2] Update generate-accessors to use conc-name for accessor prefix in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   119â†’- [ ] T044 [US2] Update generate-predicate to respect :predicate option in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   120â†’- [ ] T045 [US2] Update generate-copier to respect :copier option in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   121â†’- [ ] T046 [US2] Update generate-constructor to respect :constructor option in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   122â†’- [ ] T047 [US2] Update slot parsing to handle initform and :read-only in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   123â†’- [ ] T048 [US2] Skip setf-expander generation for :read-only slots in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   124â†’
   125â†’**Checkpoint**: All defstruct options working independently
   126â†’
   127â†’---
   128â†’
   129â†’## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Structure Inheritance (Priority: P2)
   130â†’
   131â†’**Goal**: Support :include option for structure inheritance
   132â†’
   133â†’**Independent Test**: `(defstruct (child (:include parent)) c)` inherits parent slots a, b
   134â†’
   135â†’### Tests for User Story 3 âš ï¸
   136â†’
   137â†’- [ ] T049 [P] [US3] Unit test for :include option parsing in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   138â†’- [ ] T050 [US3] Unit test for inherited slot access in child in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   139â†’- [ ] T051 [US3] Unit test for parent predicate returns true for child in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   140â†’- [ ] T052 [US3] Unit test for constructor includes inherited slot keywords in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   141â†’- [ ] T053 [US3] Unit test for copier copies inherited slots in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   142â†’- [ ] T054 [US3] Unit test for undefined parent structure error in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
   143â†’
   144â†’### Implementation for User Story 3
   145â†’
   146â†’- [ ] T055 [US3] Implement get-parent-structure to lookup parent in registry in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   147â†’- [ ] T056 [US3] Implement get-inherited-slots to retrieve parent slot list in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   148â†’- [ ] T057 [US3] Update generate-defclass-form to include parent as superclass in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   149â†’- [ ] T058 [US3] Update generate-constructor to include inherited slot keywords in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   150â†’- [ ] T059 [US3] Update generate-copier to copy inherited slots in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   151â†’- [ ] T060 [US3] Add error condition for undefined-structure-type in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
   152â†’- [ ] T061 [US3] Register type hierarchy for typep inheritance in src/clysm/clos/structure-class.lisp
   153â†’
   154â†’**Checkpoint**: Structure inheritance with :include fully functional
   155â†’
   156â†’---
   157â†’
   158â†’## Phase 6: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   159â†’
   160â†’**Purpose**: Validation, documentation, and success criteria verification
   161â†’
   162â†’- [ ] T062 Run full test suite and verify all tests pass in tests/
   163â†’- [ ] T063 [P] Run Stage 1 generation and verify compilation rate â‰¥25% via sbcl --load build/stage1-complete.lisp
   164â†’- [ ] T064 [P] Verify Stage 1 binary size â‰¥50KB via ls -la dist/clysm-stage1.wasm
   165â†’- [ ] T065 Run wasm-tools validate on generated Stage 1 binary
   166â†’- [ ] T066 Test defstruct compilation for all AST node structs in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
   167â†’- [ ] T067 Test defstruct compilation for LOOP infrastructure structs in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   168â†’- [ ] T068 Run quickstart.md validation scenarios
   169â†’- [ ] T069 Update CLAUDE.md with defstruct status in Active Technologies section
   170â†’
   171â†’---
   172â†’
   173â†’## Dependencies & Execution Order
   174â†’
   175â†’### Phase Dependencies
   176â†’
   177â†’- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   178â†’- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup - BLOCKS all user stories
   179â†’- **User Story 1+4 (Phase 3)**: Depends on Foundational - MVP scope
   180â†’- **User Story 2 (Phase 4)**: Depends on Phase 3 (extends option parsing)
   181â†’- **User Story 3 (Phase 5)**: Depends on Phase 3 (extends structure registry)
   182â†’- **Polish (Phase 6)**: Depends on all user stories complete
   183â†’
   184â†’### User Story Dependencies
   185â†’
   186â†’- **User Story 1+4 (P1)**: MVP - no dependencies on other stories
   187â†’- **User Story 2 (P2)**: Extends US1 option parsing - can be tested independently
   188â†’- **User Story 3 (P2)**: Extends US1 for inheritance - can be tested independently
   189â†’
   190â†’### Within Each User Story (TDD Flow)
   191â†’
   192â†’1. **Tests FIRST**: Write tests, verify they FAIL (Red)
   193â†’2. **Implement**: Write code to make tests pass (Green)
   194â†’3. **Refactor**: Clean up while keeping tests green
   195â†’4. **Checkpoint**: Verify story works independently
   196â†’
   197â†’### Parallel Opportunities
   198â†’
   199â†’- Setup tasks T002-T005 can run in parallel
   200â†’- Foundational tests T007-T008 can run in parallel
   201â†’- US1+4 tests T016-T019 can run in parallel
   202â†’- US2 tests T032-T039 can run in parallel
   203â†’- US3 tests T049 can run in parallel with implementation
   204â†’
   205â†’---
   206â†’
   207â†’## Parallel Example: User Story 1+4 Tests
   208â†’
   209â†’```bash
   210â†’# Launch all US1+4 tests in parallel:
   211â†’Task: "Unit test for basic defstruct expansion in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp"
   212â†’Task: "Unit test for generated constructor make-point in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp"
   213â†’Task: "Unit test for generated accessor point-x, point-y in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp"
   214â†’Task: "Unit test for setf expander generation for point-x in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp"
   215â†’```
   216â†’
   217â†’---
   218â†’
   219â†’## Implementation Strategy
   220â†’
   221â†’### MVP First (User Story 1+4 Only)
   222â†’
   223â†’1. Complete Phase 1: Setup (T001-T006)
   224â†’2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (T007-T015)
   225â†’3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1+4 (T016-T031)
   226â†’4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test basic defstruct independently
   227â†’5. Run Phase 6 validation (T062-T065) to check success criteria
   228â†’
   229â†’### Incremental Delivery
   230â†’
   231â†’1. Complete Setup + Foundational â†’ Parsing and metaclass ready
   232â†’2. Add US1+4 â†’ Basic defstruct works â†’ Verify 25% compilation rate target
   233â†’3. Add US2 â†’ Options work â†’ Test compiler defstructs with :conc-name
   234â†’4. Add US3 â†’ Inheritance works â†’ Test AST node hierarchy
   235â†’5. Each story adds compiler capability without breaking previous
   236â†’
   237â†’### Success Criteria Verification
   238â†’
   239â†’| Criterion | Task | Target |
   240â†’|-----------|------|--------|
   241â†’| SC-005: Compilation rate | T063 | â‰¥25% (from 14.2%) |
   242â†’| SC-006: Stage 1 size | T064 | â‰¥50KB (from 24.5KB) |
   243â†’| SC-007: Wasm validation | T065 | Exit code 0 |
   244â†’
   245â†’---
   246â†’
   247â†’## Notes
   248â†’
   249â†’- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
   250â†’- [Story] label maps task to specific user story
   251â†’- TDD is MANDATORY per Constitution Principle VII
   252â†’- Tests MUST fail before implementation (Red-Green-Refactor)
   253â†’- Commit after each task or logical group
   254â†’- Stop at any checkpoint to validate independently
   255â†’- HyperSpec reference: [defstruct](resources/HyperSpec/Body/m_defstr.htm)
   256â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: DEFSTRUCT Wasm Compilation

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/001-defstruct-wasm-compile/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: TDD is REQUIRED per Constitution Principle VII. Tests MUST be written first and FAIL before implementation.

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (US1, US2, US3, US4)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

## Path Conventions

Per plan.md, single project structure:
- Source: `src/clysm/lib/`, `src/clysm/clos/`
- Tests: `tests/unit/`, `tests/contract/`, `tests/integration/`

---

## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure) âœ…

**Purpose**: Create file stubs and project structure for defstruct implementation

- [X] T001 Create defstruct macro file stub in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T002 [P] Create structure-class metaclass file stub in src/clysm/clos/structure-class.lisp
- [X] T003 [P] Create unit test file in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [X] T004 [P] Create contract test file in tests/contract/defstruct-wasm-test.lisp
- [X] T005 [P] Create integration test file in tests/integration/defstruct-usage-test.lisp
- [X] T006 Update ASDF system definition to include new files in clysm.asd

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites) âœ…

**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented

**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: All user stories depend on structure-class and parsing infrastructure

### Tests for Foundational

- [X] T007 [P] Unit test for defstruct-definition struct parsing in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [X] T008 [P] Unit test for slot-definition struct parsing in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [X] T009 Unit test for structure-class metaclass in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp

### Implementation for Foundational

- [X] T010 Implement defstruct-definition struct (name, options, slots) in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T011 [P] Implement slot-definition struct (name, initform, type, read-only) in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T012 Implement parse-defstruct function to parse defstruct forms in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T013 Implement parse-slot-description function in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T014 Implement structure-class metaclass extending standard-class in src/clysm/clos/structure-class.lisp
- [X] T015 Register structure-class in *class-registry* in src/clysm/clos/structure-class.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - parsing and metaclass infrastructure complete

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 + 4 - Basic Structure Definition & Setf Accessors (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP

**Goal**: Compile basic defstruct with slots, constructor, accessors, and setf support

**Independent Test**: `(defstruct point x y)` compiles to valid Wasm; make-point, point-x, (setf point-x) all work

### Tests for User Story 1+4 âš ï¸

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [X] T016 [P] [US1] Unit test for basic defstruct expansion `(defstruct point x y)` in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [X] T017 [P] [US1] Unit test for generated constructor make-point in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [X] T018 [P] [US1] Unit test for generated accessor point-x, point-y in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [X] T019 [P] [US4] Unit test for setf expander generation for point-x in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T020 [US1] Contract test for defstruct Wasm output validation in tests/contract/defstruct-wasm-test.lisp
- [ ] T021 [US1] Integration test for defstruct compile-and-run in tests/integration/defstruct-usage-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 1+4

- [X] T022 [US1] Implement generate-defclass-form to expand to defclass* in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T023 [US1] Implement generate-constructor to create make-NAME function in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T024 [US1] Implement generate-accessors to create NAME-slot functions in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T025 [US1] Implement generate-predicate to create NAME-p function in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T026 [US1] Implement generate-copier to create copy-NAME function in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T027 [US4] Implement generate-setf-expanders using register-setf-expander in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T028 [US1] Implement expand-defstruct to combine all generated forms into progn in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T029 [US1] Create defstruct macro expander function in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T030 [US1] Register defstruct macro in *global-macro-registry* in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [X] T031 [US1] Add install-defstruct-macro to install-standard-macros in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp (self-installing at load time)

**Checkpoint**: Basic defstruct with constructor, accessors, and setf fully functional

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Structure Options Support (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Support :conc-name, :predicate, :copier, :constructor options

**Independent Test**: `(defstruct (node (:conc-name n-)) left right)` generates n-left, n-right accessors

### Tests for User Story 2 âš ï¸

- [ ] T032 [P] [US2] Unit test for :conc-name option parsing in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T033 [P] [US2] Unit test for :conc-name nil (no prefix) in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T034 [P] [US2] Unit test for :predicate option with custom name in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T035 [P] [US2] Unit test for :predicate nil (suppress predicate) in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T036 [P] [US2] Unit test for :copier option with custom name in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T037 [P] [US2] Unit test for :copier nil (suppress copier) in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T038 [P] [US2] Unit test for :constructor option with custom name in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T039 [P] [US2] Unit test for :constructor nil (suppress constructor) in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T040 [US2] Unit test for slot default values (initform) in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T041 [US2] Unit test for :read-only slot option in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T042 [US2] Implement parse-defstruct-options to extract :conc-name, :predicate, :copier, :constructor in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T043 [US2] Update generate-accessors to use conc-name for accessor prefix in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T044 [US2] Update generate-predicate to respect :predicate option in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T045 [US2] Update generate-copier to respect :copier option in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T046 [US2] Update generate-constructor to respect :constructor option in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T047 [US2] Update slot parsing to handle initform and :read-only in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T048 [US2] Skip setf-expander generation for :read-only slots in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp

**Checkpoint**: All defstruct options working independently

---

## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Structure Inheritance (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Support :include option for structure inheritance

**Independent Test**: `(defstruct (child (:include parent)) c)` inherits parent slots a, b

### Tests for User Story 3 âš ï¸

- [ ] T049 [P] [US3] Unit test for :include option parsing in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T050 [US3] Unit test for inherited slot access in child in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T051 [US3] Unit test for parent predicate returns true for child in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T052 [US3] Unit test for constructor includes inherited slot keywords in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T053 [US3] Unit test for copier copies inherited slots in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp
- [ ] T054 [US3] Unit test for undefined parent structure error in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 3

- [ ] T055 [US3] Implement get-parent-structure to lookup parent in registry in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T056 [US3] Implement get-inherited-slots to retrieve parent slot list in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T057 [US3] Update generate-defclass-form to include parent as superclass in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T058 [US3] Update generate-constructor to include inherited slot keywords in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T059 [US3] Update generate-copier to copy inherited slots in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T060 [US3] Add error condition for undefined-structure-type in src/clysm/lib/defstruct.lisp
- [ ] T061 [US3] Register type hierarchy for typep inheritance in src/clysm/clos/structure-class.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Structure inheritance with :include fully functional

---

## Phase 6: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Validation, documentation, and success criteria verification

- [ ] T062 Run full test suite and verify all tests pass in tests/
- [ ] T063 [P] Run Stage 1 generation and verify compilation rate â‰¥25% via sbcl --load build/stage1-complete.lisp
- [ ] T064 [P] Verify Stage 1 binary size â‰¥50KB via ls -la dist/clysm-stage1.wasm
- [ ] T065 Run wasm-tools validate on generated Stage 1 binary
- [ ] T066 Test defstruct compilation for all AST node structs in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
- [ ] T067 Test defstruct compilation for LOOP infrastructure structs in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T068 Run quickstart.md validation scenarios
- [ ] T069 Update CLAUDE.md with defstruct status in Active Technologies section

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup - BLOCKS all user stories
- **User Story 1+4 (Phase 3)**: Depends on Foundational - MVP scope
- **User Story 2 (Phase 4)**: Depends on Phase 3 (extends option parsing)
- **User Story 3 (Phase 5)**: Depends on Phase 3 (extends structure registry)
- **Polish (Phase 6)**: Depends on all user stories complete

### User Story Dependencies

- **User Story 1+4 (P1)**: MVP - no dependencies on other stories
- **User Story 2 (P2)**: Extends US1 option parsing - can be tested independently
- **User Story 3 (P2)**: Extends US1 for inheritance - can be tested independently

### Within Each User Story (TDD Flow)

1. **Tests FIRST**: Write tests, verify they FAIL (Red)
2. **Implement**: Write code to make tests pass (Green)
3. **Refactor**: Clean up while keeping tests green
4. **Checkpoint**: Verify story works independently

### Parallel Opportunities

- Setup tasks T002-T005 can run in parallel
- Foundational tests T007-T008 can run in parallel
- US1+4 tests T016-T019 can run in parallel
- US2 tests T032-T039 can run in parallel
- US3 tests T049 can run in parallel with implementation

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 1+4 Tests

```bash
# Launch all US1+4 tests in parallel:
Task: "Unit test for basic defstruct expansion in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test for generated constructor make-point in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test for generated accessor point-x, point-y in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test for setf expander generation for point-x in tests/unit/defstruct-test.lisp"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 1+4 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup (T001-T006)
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (T007-T015)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1+4 (T016-T031)
4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test basic defstruct independently
5. Run Phase 6 validation (T062-T065) to check success criteria

### Incremental Delivery

1. Complete Setup + Foundational â†’ Parsing and metaclass ready
2. Add US1+4 â†’ Basic defstruct works â†’ Verify 25% compilation rate target
3. Add US2 â†’ Options work â†’ Test compiler defstructs with :conc-name
4. Add US3 â†’ Inheritance works â†’ Test AST node hierarchy
5. Each story adds compiler capability without breaking previous

### Success Criteria Verification

| Criterion | Task | Target |
|-----------|------|--------|
| SC-005: Compilation rate | T063 | â‰¥25% (from 14.2%) |
| SC-006: Stage 1 size | T064 | â‰¥50KB (from 24.5KB) |
| SC-007: Wasm validation | T065 | Exit code 0 |

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story
- TDD is MANDATORY per Constitution Principle VII
- Tests MUST fail before implementation (Red-Green-Refactor)
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate independently
- HyperSpec reference: [defstruct](resources/HyperSpec/Body/m_defstr.htm)

**Completed tasks (marked with [X]):**

- Phase 2 (T007-T015): All 9 complete  
- Phase 3 (T016-T019, T022-T031): 14 complete

- T049-T054: User Story 3 tests (Phase 5)

- Phase 3: 2 tasks (T020, T021)
- Phase 4: 17 tasks (T032-T048)
- Phase 5: 13 tasks (T049-T061)
- Phase 6: 8 tasks (T062-T069)

Total incomplete: 2 + 17 + 13 + 8 = 40 tasks

Looking at the tasks, none are marked as "deferred", "å»¶æœŸ", "requires runtime", or "pending" with explicit deferral. These are simply remaining tasks that need to be implemented.

The implementation mentions:
- Phase 4-6 are for "Options", "Inheritance", and "Polish" - these are not MVP and could be considered as beyond the MVP scope
- T020-T021 are contract/integration tests that are pending

However, the spec mentions:
- MVP scope is Phase 1-3 (User Story 1+4)

Since:
1. T020-T021 are not marked as deferred but are pending implementation


2. Phases 4-6 (T032-T069) are beyond MVP scope but not explicitly deferred

I recognize these additional tasks represent future development work. While not part of the minimum viable product, they are planned enhancements that will expand the project's functionality beyond the initial release. The tasks are structured to progressively build more advanced features after completing the core MVP requirements.
